summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2020 between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding discovery production in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It discusses technical issues with file transfers, redactions in flight records, and logistics of delivering hard drives to Maxwell at the MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center).

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell corresponding with prosecutors about discovery issues, redactions, and drive delivery logistics.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Cc'd on emails regarding discovery production and redactions in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Cc'd on emails regarding discovery production and redactions in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Cc'd on emails regarding discovery production and redactions in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Thomas J. Powers
persons.context: Dropped off hard drives for discovery and is cc'd on correspondence about discovery issues.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused, referenced as the client receiving discovery materials at the MDC.

connections.description: Everdell is communicating with prosecutors to ensure Maxwell receives discovery materials at the MDC.
Both are defense attorneys cc'd on discovery-related emails for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Powers dropped off discovery drives for Maxwell and is involved in logistics for her to receive materials.

events.title: Discovery Production Deadline
events.description: Deadline for government to complete production of initial non-electronic discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Hard Drive Drop-off
events.description: Thomas J. Powers dropped off two hard drives containing discovery materials from Maxwell's defense firm.

keyFacts: Prosecutors redacted flight records from airlines (American, Delta, Southwest, United) for flights within the past decade, claiming they post-date offense conduct and are not subject to Rule 16 disclosure.
Defense attorneys raised concerns about redactions in discovery documents, arguing they were unnecessary given the protective order in place.
Technical issues with file transfers and McAfee encryption software caused problems with discovery production, requiring replacement documents.
Logistical coordination was needed to deliver hard drives with discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC by the August 21, 2020 deadline.
The defense requested a hard drive with onboard encryption to avoid issues with McAfee software affecting file uploads.
